qas.question: What's the name of the traditional Samoan dance performed by synchronized rows of dancers?
What is the name of the Samoan dance only men can perform?
The "slap dance" probably mimics the movements of Samoans trying to rid themselves of what creatures?
What is the Samoan word for rhythm?

plausible_answers.text: the fa'ataupati or the slap dance

qas.question: What is another dance not performed by men?

plausible_answers.text: This is believed to have been derived from slapping insects on the body

qas.question: Why was the siva dance created?
What kind of instruments are used when performing the siva?
What else does the sasa do besides having unique gentle movements of the body to music?

context: The Samoan word for <a0_0>dance<a0_0/> is <b5_0>siva<b5_0/> with unique gentle movements of the body in time to music and which <b9_0>tells a story<b9_0/>, although the Samoan male dances can be more physical and snappy. The <a1_0>sasa<a1_0/> is also a traditional dance where rows of dancers perform rapid synchronised movements in time to the rhythm of <a2_0><b8_0>wooden drums<b8_0/><a2_0/> (pate) or rolled mats. Another dance performed by males is called <b6_0>the <a3_0>fa'ataupati<a3_0/> or the slap dance<b6_0/>, creating rhythmic sounds by slapping different parts of the body. <b7_0>This is believed to have been derived from slapping <a4_0>insects<a4_0/> on the body<b7_0/>.
